Brought to you by the Information Security Branch  Office of the Chief Information Officer
1. Why is it important to keep different passwords for different accounts?
It saves data storage space in file-servers

answer.title: It saves data storage space in file-servers

ContentStructure.title: It is a good habit for your memory so that you can remember things overall

answer.title: It is a good habit for your memory so that you can remember things overall

ContentStructure.title: To keep hackers from being able to access all your accounts if one account is compromised.

answer.title: To keep hackers from being able to access all your accounts if one account is compromised.

ContentStructure.title: Websites might think you are a scammer otherwise.

answer.title: Websites might think you are a scammer otherwise.

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  C  Hackers will often hack more vulnerable targets just to get the user passwords. If a user uses that same password for different accounts, the hacker gets access to more secure systems. It is important to keep them different to keep this from happening, even if you don’t expect to be hacked.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  C  Hackers will often hack more vulnerable targets just to get the user passwords. If a user uses that same password for different accounts, the hacker gets access to more secure systems. It is important to keep them different to keep this from happening, even if you don’t expect to be hacked.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 1. Why is it important to keep different passwords for different accounts?

ContentStructure.title: 2.  Why is it important that strangers don’t know details about my life like your birthdate and mother’s maiden name?
Because your mother might not be too happy about that

answer.title: Because your mother might not be too happy about that

ContentStructure.title: You don’t know what strangers’ intentions are

answer.title: You don’t know what strangers’ intentions are

ContentStructure.title: So that hackers can’t steal your identity and change your passwords

answer.title: So that hackers can’t steal your identity and change your passwords
All of the above

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  D  Many password recovery systems require details about your life in order to gain access to your account. Some of these details should be kept private so that hackers can’t gain access to your accounts. Common details are your mother’s maid name, your birthdate and your first pet’s name. While it is okay for friends and family to know these details, you probably shouldn’t post it publicly on the internet.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  D  Many password recovery systems require details about your life in order to gain access to your account. Some of these details should be kept private so that hackers can’t gain access to your accounts. Common details are your mother’s maid name, your birthdate and your first pet’s name. While it is okay for friends and family to know these details, you probably shouldn’t post it publicly on the internet.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 2.  Why is it important that strangers don’t know details about my life like your birthdate and mother’s maiden name?

ContentStructure.title: 3.  Why do organisations try to keep passwords long and complex with symbols and numbers?
Because it makes them harder to guess

answer.title: Because it makes them harder to guess

ContentStructure.title: So that it makes it difficult for users to access their accounts

answer.title: So that it makes it difficult for users to access their accounts

ContentStructure.title: So that it makes it harder to hackers to decrypt them

answer.title: So that it makes it harder to hackers to decrypt them
All of the Above
A and C only

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  E  The most important part of a password is that it is only known by you. Password requirements are based around what makes it hard for a person to guess it, or what makes it hard from someone to get your password out of encrypted data. Many hackers use brute force attacks that try every possible combination of password to figure it out. The more complex the password, the longer it takes to break the encryption.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  E  The most important part of a password is that it is only known by you. Password requirements are based around what makes it hard for a person to guess it, or what makes it hard from someone to get your password out of encrypted data. Many hackers use brute force attacks that try every possible combination of password to figure it out. The more complex the password, the longer it takes to break the encryption.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 3.  Why do organisations try to keep passwords long and complex with symbols and numbers?

ContentStructure.title: 4.  What action should every employer take immediately when an employee leaves their job?
Disable their email and system accounts

answer.title: Disable their email and system accounts
Provide a reference
Organize a farewell event
Fill the vacant position

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  A  As the employee leaves, their account(s) should be disabled. If this is not done, an open and unused account can be exploited by hackers. It is easy for a old employee account to slip through the cracks and leave a vulnerability in the system. After all, the employee isn’t there to notice if something is suspicious.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  A  As the employee leaves, their account(s) should be disabled. If this is not done, an open and unused account can be exploited by hackers. It is easy for a old employee account to slip through the cracks and leave a vulnerability in the system. After all, the employee isn’t there to notice if something is suspicious.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 4.  What action should every employer take immediately when an employee leaves their job?

ContentStructure.title: 5. When you set up a new Wi-Fi enabled device (printer, home-entertainment, appliance, etc...), what should you do before using it?
Look up videos of how to use it online

answer.title: Look up videos of how to use it online

ContentStructure.title: Set up a secure password for wireless access

answer.title: Set up a secure password for wireless access

ContentStructure.title: Bolt it down so people can’t walk off with it

answer.title: Bolt it down so people can’t walk off with it

ContentStructure.title: Invite your pals so they can check it out

answer.title: Invite your pals so they can check it out

ContentStructure.title: Incorrect - Answer:  B  More and more devices can connect wirelessly as part of what we call the Internet of Things (IoT). Not all of these devices come with preconfigured security settings. Make sure that you secure these devices with a password so that hackers can’t wirelessly access the electronics in your home. Cases have been found of hackers reading data from a printer to get confidential information, or even hacking a home calendar to discover when the owners are out of the house. Be safe and sure that you are safe by securing all of your IoT devices.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  B  More and more devices can connect wirelessly as part of what we call the Internet of Things (IoT). Not all of these devices come with preconfigured security settings. Make sure that you secure these devices with a password so that hackers can’t wirelessly access the electronics in your home. Cases have been found of hackers reading data from a printer to get confidential information, or even hacking a home calendar to discover when the owners are out of the house. Be safe and sure that you are safe by securing all of your IoT devices.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.text: 5. When you set up a new Wi-Fi enabled device (printer, home-entertainment, appliance, etc...), what should you do before using it?

ContentStructure.title: 6.  What safeguards should you take when connecting to an unsecured Wi-Fi hotspot?

answer.title: dummy title
Don’t use your keyboard

ContentStructure.title: Don’t do any important transactions like electronic-banking

answer.title: dummy title
Don’t do any important transactions like electronic-banking

ContentStructure.title: Keep your laptop hidden from view

answer.title: dummy title
Keep your laptop hidden from view

ContentStructure.title: Be aware that your online activities may be monitored

answer.title: dummy title
Be aware that your online activities may be monitored

ContentStructure.title: Confirm the name of the hotspot with the organisation that runs it

answer.title: dummy title
Confirm the name of the hotspot with the organisation that runs it

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answers: B, D, E  WiFi hotspots are not secure. Be aware of everything you share over the connection. Only uses HTTPS enabled sites helps (as opposed to HTTP), but ultimately you just have to be mindful that everything you do through that connection is in ‘’plain sight’ to hackers. Don’t send any private information like banking info or personal documents. You never know where it might end up. You can also confirm the name of the wireless network with local staff. Sometimes hackers set up lookalike networks to misdirect your connections and collect your information.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answers: B, D, E  WiFi hotspots are not secure. Be aware of everything you share over the connection. Only uses HTTPS enabled sites helps (as opposed to HTTP), but ultimately you just have to be mindful that everything you do through that connection is in ‘’plain sight’ to hackers. Don’t send any private information like banking info or personal documents. You never know where it might end up. You can also confirm the name of the wireless network with local staff. Sometimes hackers set up lookalike networks to misdirect your connections and collect your information.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

Partially Correct - Answers: B, D, E  WiFi hotspots are not secure. Be aware of everything you share over the connection. Only uses HTTPS enabled sites helps (as opposed to HTTP), but ultimately you just have to be mindful that everything you do through that connection is in ‘’plain sight’ to hackers. Don’t send any private information like banking info or personal documents. You never know where it might end up. You can also confirm the name of the wireless network with local staff. Sometimes hackers set up lookalike networks to misdirect your connections and collect your information.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

ContentStructure.title: 7. If you are speaking to a tech support representative, what signs should you look out for to make sure you aren’t being scammed?
They contact you when you haven’t reported an issue

answer.title: dummy title
They contact you when you haven’t reported an issue

ContentStructure.title: If they ask for financial information

answer.title: dummy title
If they ask for financial information

ContentStructure.title: They email you tips and information about the issue

answer.title: dummy title
They email you tips and information about the issue
dummy title
They ask for your passwords

ContentStructure.title: They ask about issues you’ve been facing

answer.title: dummy title
They ask about issues you’ve been facing

ContentStructure.title: You’ve never heard of this tech support provider before

answer.title: dummy title
You’ve never heard of this tech support provider before

ContentStructure.title: Your computer hasn’t been having issues

answer.title: dummy title
Your computer hasn’t been having issues

ContentStructure.title: They seem concerned about closing tickets quickly

answer.title: dummy title
They seem concerned about closing tickets quickly

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:   A, B, D, F, G  Scammers will often pose as support technicians and pretend to ‘fix’ your computer while stealing information and installing malware. Often it will be when you haven’t reported an issue, and they’ll conveniently need your passwords or administrator access to your computer. If something doesn’t feel right, make sure to verify by looking up the official number of your tech support and checking to see the details of how they are providing support . Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:   A, B, D, F, G  Scammers will often pose as support technicians and pretend to ‘fix’ your computer while stealing information and installing malware. Often it will be when you haven’t reported an issue, and they’ll conveniently need your passwords or administrator access to your computer. If something doesn’t feel right, make sure to verify by looking up the official number of your tech support and checking to see the details of how they are providing support.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

Partially Correct - Answer:   A, B, D, F, G  Scammers will often pose as support technicians and pretend to ‘fix’ your computer while stealing information and installing malware. Often it will be when you haven’t reported an issue, and they’ll conveniently need your passwords or administrator access to your computer. If something doesn’t feel right, make sure to verify by looking up the official number of your tech support and checking to see the details of how they are providing support.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 7. If you are speaking to a tech support representative, what signs should you look out for to make sure you aren’t being scammed?

ContentStructure.title: 8.  When should you give out your workplace password?
When they are a close pal and you can trust them

answer.title: When they are a close pal and you can trust them

ContentStructure.title: Passwords don’t matter so you can give them to anyone

answer.title: Passwords don’t matter so you can give them to anyone

ContentStructure.title: To your supervisor if they ask for it

answer.title: To your supervisor if they ask for it

ContentStructure.title: To tech support if they request it

answer.title: To tech support if they request it
To no one

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  E  Passwords are designed to be for your eyes only. Even if you trust your friend, you shouldn’t give your password because you are held responsible for anything that they do with your account. If tech support or a supervisor needs to get access to your account, there are official channels where they can get temporary access to your account without getting your password. Your password is only for you, so watch out if someone is asking for your password.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  E  Passwords are designed to be for your eyes only. Even if you trust your friend, you shouldn’t give your password because you are held responsible for anything that they do with your account. If tech support or a supervisor needs to get access to your account, there are official channels where they can get temporary access to your account without getting your password. Your password is only for you, so watch out if someone is asking for your password.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.
